title: Below is a reading list of 20 articles up to 2020 that focus on Natural Language Processing (NLP) for endangered languages, with an emphasis on language documentation and the challenges faced by current NLP models
Natural Language Processing for Endangered Languages
Overview of NLP applications for endangered languages and the challenges involved
On Achieving and Evaluating Language-Independence in NLP
Discusses the importance of language-independent NLP tools and their relevance to endangered languages
Documenting and Revitalizing Indigenous Languages: The Leanne Hinton Effect
Examines the impact of language documentation efforts on revitalization, with implications for NLP
Data and Language Documentation
container-title: The Oxford Handbook of Linguistic Fieldwork.**

title: Explores the types of data collected in language documentation and their use in NLP
Language Documentation: What is it and what is it good for?
Provides a foundational understanding of language documentation and its goals
The Role of Language Documentation in the Revitalization of Indigenous Languages
container-title: The Cambridge Handbook of Endangered Languages.**

title: Discusses how documentation efforts can support language revitalization and the role of NLP
Challenges of language technologies for the indigenous languages of the Americas
container-title: Proceedings of the 27th International Conference on Computational Linguistics.**

title: Reviews the specific challenges faced by NLP technologies for indigenous languages
Machine Translation for Language Preservation
Investigates the potential of machine translation for preserving endangered languages
A Case Study on Using Speech-to-Text Technology for Language Documentation in the Field
container-title: Proceedings of the 2nd Workshop on the Use of Computational Methods in the Study of Endangered Languages.**

title: Case study on the application of speech-to-text technology in language documentation
Towards a Transcription Acceleration System for Field Linguists
container-title: Proceedings of the 2nd Workshop on the Use of Computational Methods in the Study of Endangered Languages.**

title: Proposes a system to accelerate the transcription process for field linguists
iLex: A tool for integrating sign language corpus linguistics and language technology
container-title: Proceedings of the 6th International Conference on Language Resources and Evaluation (LREC).**

title: Discusses tools for documenting sign languages, which are often endangered
Atlas of the World’s Languages in Danger
Provides an overview of the world's endangered languages and the documentation efforts
The Role of Technology in Language Documentation
container-title: Proceedings of the 2nd Workshop on the Use of Computational Methods in the Study of Endangered Languages.**

title: Examines the role of various technologies in language documentation
Essentials of Language Documentation
A comprehensive guide on the principles and practices of language documentation
Challenges and Strategies for Indigenous Language Technology: From Speech and Text to Language Revitalization
container-title: Proceedings of the 3rd Workshop on the Use of Computational Methods in the Study of Endangered Languages.**

title: Discusses strategies for developing NLP tools for indigenous languages
Language Documentation and Archiving: The State of the Art
Reviews the current state and challenges of language documentation and archiving
A Scalable Method for Preserving Oral Literature from Small Languages
container-title: Proceedings of the 12th International Conference on Language Resources and Evaluation (LREC).**

title: Proposes scalable methods for preserving oral literature using NLP
HamNoSys—Representing Sign Language Data in Language Resources and Language Processing Contexts
container-title: Proceedings of the 4th International Conference on Language Resources and Evaluation (LREC).**

title: Discusses the representation of sign language data for NLP applications
A Grand Challenge for Linguistics: Scaling Up and Integrating Models
container-title: Proceedings of the 48th Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics.**

title: Proposes a grand challenge for linguistics to scale up and integrate models, relevant for endangered languages
Documentary and Descriptive Linguistics
Differentiates between documentary and descriptive linguistics, with implications for NLP
These articles provide a comprehensive overview of the intersection between NLP and endangered languages, focusing on documentation and the unique challenges faced by current models
